doc:
Robert Armstrong (actor) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Armstrong_(actor) 0 Robert Armstrong (November 20, 1890 – April 20, 1973) was an American film actor remembered for his role as Carl Denham in the 1933 version of King Kong by RKO Pictures. He uttered the famous exit quote, "'it wasn't the airplanes, T'was beauty killed the beast," at the film's end. Robert_Armstrong ( November_20_,_1890 – April_20_,_1973 ) was an_American_film_actor remembered for his_role as Carl_Denham in the_1933_version of King_Kong by RKO_Pictures . He uttered the_famous_exit_quote , " ' it was n't the_airplanes , T'was beauty killed the_beast , " at the_film 's_end .
